text:
Alexandria Governorate ("Muḥāfẓet El Eskenderiya") is one of the governorates of Egypt. The city of Alexandria was historically the capital of Egypt. Later Fustat was built, and this became Cairo. Today the governorate is considered second in importance to the Cairo Governorate. It is on the northern coast of Egypt, on the Mediterranean Sea. It is one of the most important harbours in Egypt.
Tourism.
Alexandria has a diverse history. It was occupied by several cultures through the years. Alexandria has many historic sites and several monuments.
Education.
Alexandria Governorate follows the Egyptian Educational System in its public schools and universities.
